org.validator.ui

Class ResultPublisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.validator.ui.ResultPublisher

  • public class ResultPublisher
extends java.lang.Object
    This class transforms the XML result files into user-friendly web pages.
    Author:
    danielgalassi@gmail.com

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) javax.servlet.ServletContext context
      Scope of the servlet session.
      (package private) java.io.File index
      File containing all result entries.
      private static org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger 
      (package private) java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> pages
      Different HTML pages to generate (names of stylesheets and HTML pages are the same).
      (package private) java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params
      Parameters passed to stylesheets.
      (package private) java.lang.String resultCatalog
      Path where results are stored.
      (package private) java.lang.String viewCatalog
      Path to the stylesheets used to create HTML pages.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ResultPublisher()
      Publisher constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void generatePages()
      Creates HTML pages.
      private void generateZip()
      Creates a compressed file with a summary and detail pages.
      java.lang.String getResultsPage()
      Publishes the location of the summary page.
      private boolean ready()
      Verifies that the Publisher has been properly setup
      void run()
      Creates all HTML pages used for browsing and downloading.

      Sets the directories where results and stylesheets are stored.
      void setContext(javax.servlet.ServletContext context)
      Sets the scope of the servlet, it is used to load stylesheets.

    • Field Detail

      • logger

        private static final org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger

      • viewCatalog

        java.lang.String viewCatalog
        Path to the stylesheets used to create HTML pages.

      • resultCatalog

        java.lang.String resultCatalog
        Path where results are stored.

      • context

        javax.servlet.ServletContext context
        Scope of the servlet session.

      • index

        java.io.File index
        File containing all result entries.

      • pages

        java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> pages
        Different HTML pages to generate (names of stylesheets and HTML pages are the same).

      • params

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params
        Parameters passed to stylesheets. This makes the process of generating HTML pages more flexible.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResultPublisher

        public ResultPublisher()
        Publisher constructor. Catalogues, context and publishing parameters will be setup following a builder-type approach.

    • Method Detail

      • setCatalogs

        public void setCatalogs(java.lang.String resultCatalog,
                        java.lang.String viewCatalog)
        Sets the directories where results and stylesheets are stored.
        Parameters:
        resultCatalog - path to results
        viewCatalog - path to stylesheets

      • setContext

        public void setContext(javax.servlet.ServletContext context)
        Sets the scope of the servlet, it is used to load stylesheets.
        Parameters:
        context - scope of servlet session

      • setParameters

        public void setParameters(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String value)
        Name, value pairs used to generate stylesheet parameters.
        Parameters:
        name - argument referenced in stylesheets
        value - literal evaluated during the transformation

      • generatePages

        private void generatePages()
        Creates HTML pages.

      • generateZip

        private void generateZip()
        Creates a compressed file with a summary and detail pages.

      • run

        public void run()
        Creates all HTML pages used for browsing and downloading.

      • ready

        private boolean ready()
        Verifies that the Publisher has been properly setup
        Returns:
        true if catalogues, context and parameters are valid

      • getResultsPage

        public java.lang.String getResultsPage()
        Publishes the location of the summary page.
        Returns:
        the summary page location in the context of the servlet session
